translated: and performs the act of banishing, then one does not confess the act of threatening.

original: de ltar yang nye ba 'khor bsdigs pa yang gzhan la smad pa yang gzhan bskrad pa yang gzhan phyir 'gyed pa yang gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang nye ba 'khor bsdigs pa yang gzhan la smad pa yang gzhan bskrad pa yang gzhan phyir 'gyed pa yang gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, Upāli, threatening is one thing, censuring is another, banishing is another, and reconciliation is another.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no//🔽gzhan la nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no// gzhan la nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Their causes are different.

original: nan thur gzhan byas pa la snga ma nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: nan thur gzhan byas pa la snga ma nyams pa yin te /
translated: “It is lost with regard to another” means that the former is lost with regard to another who has committed an offense,

original: gzhan mi 'chags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'chags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that the other is not confessed.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: nan thur gzhan byas na nan thur sngar byas pa nyams so //
analyzed: nan thur gzhan byas na nan thur sngar byas pa nyams so //
translated: If one commits another offense, the former offense is lost.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las btsun pa re @301b zhig bsdigs pa'i las bgyis pa la smad pa'i las bgyid na bgyis par brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las btsun pa re @301b zhig bsdigs pa'i las bgyis pa la smad pa'i las bgyid na bgyis par brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, if one performs a censure procedure after performing a suspension procedure, is it called performed?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “It is called performed.

original: bsdigs pa'i las ni bag yangs su gyur to //
analyzed: bsdigs pa'i las ni bag yangs su gyur to //
translated: The suspension procedure becomes relaxed.”

original: btsun pa gnas nas phyung ba la bsdigs pa'i las bgyid na bgyis par brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa gnas nas phyung ba la bsdigs pa'i las bgyid na bgyis par brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, if one performs a censure procedure against one who has been expelled, is it called performed?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
translated: “Upāli, it is not.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: de ni longs mi spyod pa'i phyir song ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gnas nas phyung ba la ni mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni longs mi spyod pa'i phyir song ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // gnas nas phyung ba la ni mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because he is not a member of the saṅgha.”🔽“One does not confess a suspension procedure against one who has been expelled.”

original: gnas nas dbyung ba'i bdag nyid kyi nan thur byas pa la ni bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i nan thur gyi las gzhan mi 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas dbyung ba'i bdag nyid kyi nan thur byas pa la ni bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i nan thur gyi las gzhan mi 'chags pa'o //
translated: “One does not confess a suspension procedure, etc., against one who has been expelled.”

original: snga ma nyams par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga ma nyams par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: “One does not lose the previous status.”

original: de longs spyod pa'i phyir song ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de longs spyod pa'i phyir song ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have gone for the sake of enjoying those.

original: shes pa dang bsod nams chen po dang mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang thos pa mang ba dang phyogs mang ba dang 'khor mang ba dag la ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa dang bsod nams chen po dang mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang thos pa mang ba dang phyogs mang ba dang 'khor mang ba dag la ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one expels a monk who has great knowledge, great merit, who upholds the sūtras, the vinaya, or the mātṛkā, who has great learning, who has a great retinue, or who has a great following, it is a serious offense belonging to the category of schism.

original: shes pa dang bsod nams che ba dang mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang thos pa mang ba dang phyogs mang ba dang / 'khor mang ba dang chos kyis gnas nas 'byin na dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang bsod nams che ba dang mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang thos pa mang ba dang phyogs mang ba dang / 'khor mang ba dang chos kyis gnas nas 'byin na dbyen gyi skabs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one expels a monk who has great knowledge, great merit, who upholds the sūtras, the vinaya, or the mātṛkā, who has great learning, who has a great retinue, or who has a great following, and who is abiding in the Dharma, it is a serious offense belonging to the category of schism.

original: thos pa mang ba zhes smos pas mi rtog ge dang sgra dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pa mang ba zhes smos pas mi rtog ge dang sgra dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The term “great learning” includes those who are non-analytical, those who are verbal, and those who are speculative.

original: gal te dbye bar 'dod pas gnas nas 'byin na ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: gal te dbye bar 'dod pas gnas nas 'byin na ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one expels a monk with the intention of causing a schism, it is a serious offense.

original: dbye bar mi 'dod pas gnas nas 'byin na ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbye bar mi 'dod pas gnas nas 'byin na ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not wish to separate them, but expels them from the monastery, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct that is a part of the preparation.

original: khyim pa ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A layperson is an example.

original: khyim pa la brnyas thabs byed pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs su khyim pa zhes smos pa ni dge slong la sogs pa lnga bo dag ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa la brnyas thabs byed pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs su khyim pa zhes smos pa ni dge slong la sogs pa lnga bo dag ni dpe yin no //
translated: In the context of the statement, “An act of reconciliation is performed for one who acts disrespectfully toward a layperson,” the term “layperson” is an example of the five, such as a fully ordained monk and so on.

original: dge slong la sogs pa lnga po dag la brnyas thabs byed pa la yang phyir 'gyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong la sogs pa lnga po dag la brnyas thabs byed pa la yang phyir 'gyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: An act of reconciliation is also performed for one who acts disrespectfully toward the five, such as a fully ordained monk and so on.

original: khyim ba la brnyas thabs byed pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: khyim ba la brnyas thabs byed pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: The statement, “An act of reconciliation is performed for one who acts disrespectfully toward a layperson,” is merely an example.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma dag la brnyas thabs byed pa dag la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma dag la brnyas thabs byed pa dag la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: An act of reconciliation is also performed for one who acts disrespectfully toward fully ordained monks, fully ordained nuns, female novices, female trainee nuns, and female probationary nuns.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun @302a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun @302a * //
translated: Here is the text:🔽“Venerable Gautama, I have a question for you, if you would be so kind as to answer it.”

original: pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong khyim pa la brnyas thabs bgyid pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong khyim pa la brnyas thabs bgyid pa la phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Monks, you should perform the act of reconciliation for monks who disrespect householders.”

original: btsun pa dge slong la brnyas thabs bgyid par gyur na de la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong la brnyas thabs bgyid par gyur na de la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, if a monk disrespects another monk, should he also perform the act of reconciliation?”

original: nye ba 'khor bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, you should,” and so on.

original: khro ba ni brnyas thabs ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khro ba ni brnyas thabs ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Anger is not disrespect.

original: khro ba ni brnyas thabs byed pa yin pas de la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khro ba ni brnyas thabs byed pa yin pas de la yang phyir 'gyed pa'i las bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Anger is disrespect, so the act of reconciliation should be performed for that.

original: nan thur gyi las dag la thun mong ma yin ga dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nan thur gyi las dag la thun mong ma yin ga dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You should not doubt the acts of censure.

original: nan thur gyi las dag la dge slong dang dge slong ma thun mong ma yin par dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: nan thur gyi las dag la dge slong dang dge slong ma thun mong ma yin par dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: You should not doubt that the acts of censure are not common to both monks and nuns.

original: dge slong ma rnams la yang na thur gyi las dag bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la yang na thur gyi las dag bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The acts of censure are to be performed for nuns.

original: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa la yang de dag bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa la yang de dag bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And for one who has gone forth and been ordained, those are to be done.

original: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa la yang nan thur gyi las dag bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa la yang nan thur gyi las dag bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: And for one who has gone forth and been ordained, those harsh actions are to be done.

original: khyim pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But not for a layperson.

original: khyim pa la nan thur gyi las dag mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyim pa la nan thur gyi las dag mi bya ba ste /
translated: Harsh actions are not to be done for a layperson.

original: de la dge 'dun mi dbang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun mi dbang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Saṅgha does not have power over them.

original: dge slong la pham par 'gyur ba yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa dang gshe ba dang spyo ba la lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong la pham par 'gyur ba yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa dang gshe ba dang spyo ba la lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a layperson falsely accuses, reviles, or insults a monk of a defeating offense, the monk should cover his bowl with his outer robe.

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The monk should cover his bowl with his outer robe by means of a procedure consisting of a single announcement.

original: su la khas dbub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: su la khas dbub par bya zhe na /
translated: To whom should he cover his bowl?

original: de'i phyir dge slong la pham par 'gyur ba yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa'i khyim pa la'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong la pham par 'gyur ba yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa'i khyim pa la'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, he should cover his bowl with his outer robe for a layperson who falsely accuses a monk of a defeating offense.

original: 'dir dge slong zhes smos pa ni chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dge slong zhes smos pa ni chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Here, the term monk is an example of one who has gone forth in this Dharma.

original: pham par 'gyur ba zhes smos pa yang dpe yin te /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba zhes smos pa yang dpe yin te /
translated: The term one who has committed a defeating offense is also an example.

original: tshul khrims lhur bya ba yin gyi lhung ba ltung bya ba ni ma yin no //🔽des na rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la skur pa 'debs pa la yang lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims lhur bya ba yin gyi lhung ba ltung bya ba ni ma yin no // des na rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la skur pa 'debs pa la yang lhung bzed khas dbub par bya'o //
translated: One should be intent on morality, not on falling into offenses.

original: yang dag ma yin pas skur ba zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: yang dag ma yin pas skur ba zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Therefore, one should turn one's bowl upside down for one who has gone forth but has not completed the novitiate and for one who reviles the Buddha.🔽As for one who falsely reviles,

original: brdzun gyis skur pa 'debs pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: brdzun gyis skur pa 'debs pa ste de la'o //
translated: this refers to one who reviles with lies.

original: gshe ba dang spyo ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gshe ba dang spyo ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for one who reviles and scolds,

original: rab tu byung ba 'di la yang dag pa yang rung yang dag pa ma yin pa yang rung bas gshe ba dang spyo bar byed pas khyim pa la yang lhung bzed khas dbub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di la yang dag pa yang rung yang dag pa ma yin pa yang rung bas gshe ba dang spyo bar byed pas khyim pa la yang lhung bzed khas dbub par bya ba'o //
translated: this refers to one who reviles and scolds householders, whether rightly or wrongly, for this monk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i @302b khyim pa dag la lhung bzed las dbub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i @302b khyim pa dag la lhung bzed las dbub par bya ste /
translated: Here, the text says, One should turn one's bowl upside down for householders who possess two qualities.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dge slong dag la gshe ba dang spyo par byed pa dang / dge slong dag pa la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa la'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽ci khas bub tu gzhag pas khas dbub par bya 'am /
analyzed: dge slong dag la gshe ba dang spyo par byed pa dang / dge slong dag pa la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa la'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // ci khas bub tu gzhag pas khas dbub par bya 'am /
translated: They are: reviling and insulting monks, and falsely charging a pure monk with the offense of defeat.🔽Should one be seated with one’s head lowered, or should another be seated with his head lowered?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis she na de'i phyir rnam par gzhag par bya bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis she na de'i phyir rnam par gzhag par bya bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by the act of positing.”

original: 'dir lhung bzed bzed par mi bya'o zhes khrims su bca' ba rnam par gzhag par bya bas yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir lhung bzed bzed par mi bya'o zhes khrims su bca' ba rnam par gzhag par bya bas yin gyi /
translated: Here, the rule is posited as follows: “One should not hold out one’s alms bowl.”

original: lhung bzed kyi dbyibs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi dbyibs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not posited by the shape of the alms bowl.

original: rnam pa gang gis de rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsol bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis de rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsol bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: By what procedure is it posited? Therefore, it is said, “by the act of requesting.”

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis so //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis so //
translated: It is by the act of requesting alone.

original: de'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni /
translated: The formula for that is:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: “Venerable monks, please listen!

original: litstsha b'i chen pos tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang dag pa ma lags pas skur na /
analyzed: litstsha b'i chen pos tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang dag pa ma lags pas skur na /
translated: The great Licchavi said to the venerable Cūdapanthaka, “You have been slandered with what is untrue.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyi litstsha b'a chen po la lhung bzed khas dbub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyi litstsha b'a chen po la lhung bzed khas dbub par bgyi'o //
translated: If it is the right time for the Saṅgha and it is acceptable, then I ask the Saṅgha to approve the covering of the great Licchavi’s alms bowl.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the motion.”

original: gang gi phyir de khas phub pa de'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de khas phub pa de'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The reason for covering his bowl should be stated.

original: lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Do not go to a house where the alms bowl is covered.

original: stan la 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stan la 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not sit on a seat.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos bshams pa la yongs su longs spyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos bshams pa la yongs su longs spyod par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not enjoy the things that are prepared to be given.

original: bsod snyoms lang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms lang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not go for alms.

original: chos bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Do not teach the Dharma.”

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos bshams pa la yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes smos pas ni gtsug lag khang yang spang bar byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos bshams pa la yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes smos pas ni gtsug lag khang yang spang bar byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should not use the articles that are to be given in charity should be understood to mean that one should not use the monastery.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here reads:

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos sngar bshams pa dag la yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gang du las bya ba dar gtogs pa dag la khas phub pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos sngar bshams pa dag la yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // gang du las bya ba dar gtogs pa dag la khas phub pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not use the articles that are to be given in charity that have been set aside.🔽 The phrase one should turn over the begging bowls to the householders who belong to the monastery where the legal procedure is performed means

original: gnas kyi gzhi gang du las bya ba der gtogs pa'i khyim bdag rnams la lhung bzed khas phub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas kyi gzhi gang du las bya ba der gtogs pa'i khyim bdag rnams la lhung bzed khas phub pa nyid yin no //
translated: that one should turn over the begging bowls to the householders who belong to the monastery where the legal procedure is performed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here reads:

original: dge slong gis khyim bdag bzhi'i gnas bzhi po dag tu lhung bzed bzhi khas dbub par 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis khyim bdag bzhi'i gnas bzhi po dag tu lhung bzed bzhi khas dbub par 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Is it possible for a monk to turn over four begging bowls to four householders in four different households?

original: bka' stsal pa yod de /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa yod de /
translated: The Buddha said, Yes, it is possible.

original: khri'am khri'u'am @303a * //
analyzed: khri'am khri'u'am @303a * //
translated: A monk may turn over a begging bowl to a householder who is sitting on a couch, a chair, a stool, or a sofa.

original: shing ngam re ldes gnas bzhi po dag gi mtshams dag mnan te khas dbub par byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽tha na gnas nas phyung ba phan chad rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i khyim du de mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /🔽tha na gnas nas phyung ba phan chad nas rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa tshun chad kyi dge slong gis yon bdag gi khyim du lhung bzed khas dbub pa de mi 'chags so //
analyzed: shing ngam re ldes gnas bzhi po dag gi mtshams dag mnan te khas dbub par byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // tha na gnas nas phyung ba phan chad rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i khyim du de mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni / tha na gnas nas phyung ba phan chad nas rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa tshun chad kyi dge slong gis yon bdag gi khyim du lhung bzed khas dbub pa de mi 'chags so //
translated: If a monk or novice monk presses down on the four corners of a mat or a rug and turns it face down.🔽At the very least, a monk who is not in agreement with the faction should not turn it face up in a house that is not in agreement with the faction.🔽At the very least, a monk who is not in agreement with the faction should not turn face up the alms bowl of a monk who is not in agreement with the faction in the house of a patron.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong khas blangs pa dag gis khas ma blangs pa dag gi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub par byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong khas blangs pa dag gis khas ma blangs pa dag gi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub par byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here is the text: “If monks who are in agreement with the faction turn face down the alms bowls of householders who are not in agreement with the faction in their houses, they should say, ‘It is not turned face down.’

original: de bzhin du gnas nas phyung ba dag gis rang bzhin du gnas pa dag gi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub pa byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas nas phyung ba dag gis rang bzhin du gnas pa dag gi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub pa byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, if those who have been expelled from the monastery cover the begging bowls of those who are living in the monastery in the houses of householders, they should say, “Do not cover it.”

original: de bzhin du gnas par mi bya ba dag gis khyim pa dag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub par byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas par mi bya ba dag gis khyim pa dag rnams kyi khyim dag tu lhung bzed khas dbub par byed na khas ma phub par brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, if those who are not living in the monastery cover the begging bowls of householders in their houses, they should say, “Do not cover it.”

original: de 'ga' zhig gis go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de 'ga' zhig gis go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Someone should inform them.”

original: lhung bzed khas phub pa de dge slong 'ga' zhig gis khyim bdag de la dge 'dun gyis khyod la ltung bzed khas phub po zhes go bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed khas phub pa de dge slong 'ga' zhig gis khyim bdag de la dge 'dun gyis khyod la ltung bzed khas phub po zhes go bar bya'o //
translated: That is, a monk should inform the householder, “The Saṅgha has covered your begging bowl.”

original: bzed par gsol ba dang ldan na gsal bas bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzed par gsol ba dang ldan na gsal bas bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he requests that it be uncovered, it should be uncovered by someone else.”

original: khyim bdag des dge slong gang la skur ba'am gshe ba dang spyod ba byas pa'i dge slong de la bzod pa gsol zin pa dang ldan zhing dge 'dun la lhung bzed phyir bzlog par gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum yang brjod na de la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba
analyzed: khyim bdag des dge slong gang la skur ba'am gshe ba dang spyod ba byas pa'i dge slong de la bzod pa gsol zin pa dang ldan zhing dge 'dun la lhung bzed phyir bzlog par gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum yang brjod na de la dge 'dun gyis gsol ba
translated: The householder should ask for forgiveness from the monk whom he has slandered, reviled, or treated with contempt. If he has done this and has also recited the formula for returning the begging bowl three times, the Saṅgha should🔽return the begging bowl to him by means of a single proclamation.

original: 'ba' zhig gi las kyis lhung bzed phyir bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi las kyis lhung bzed phyir bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: The formula for the single proclamation is as follows:

original: de la gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: “Venerable sirs, listen!

original: bdag li tstsha b'i chen po mi dge ba'i grogs pos bslus pas 'phags pa gyad bu nor la yang dag ba ma lags pas skur pas dge 'dun gyis bdag la lhung bzed khas dbub pa mdzad de /
analyzed: bdag li tstsha b'i chen po mi dge ba'i grogs pos bslus pas 'phags pa gyad bu nor la yang dag ba ma lags pas skur pas dge 'dun gyis bdag la lhung bzed khas dbub pa mdzad de /
translated: I, the Licchavi Mahādeva, was deceived by a nonvirtuous friend. I falsely slandered the noble Ghaṭikāra, and the Saṅgha covered my begging bowl.

original: bdag lhung bzed khas phub pa dge 'dun las lhung bzed slar bzlog par gsol na /
analyzed: bdag lhung bzed khas phub pa dge 'dun las lhung bzed slar bzlog par gsol na /
translated: I ask the Saṅgha to return my begging bowl.

original: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung ste lhung @303b bzer slar bzlog tu gsol //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung ste lhung @303b bzer slar bzlog tu gsol //
translated: May the noble saṅgha of compassionate monks, out of compassion, take back the alms-bowl that was turned face down.”

original: lan gsum du bzlas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is to be repeated three times.

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi sngags ni /
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi sngags ni /
translated: The formula for the request alone is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: li tstsha b'i chen po mi dge ba'i grogs pos bslus pa 'dis /
analyzed: li tstsha b'i chen po mi dge ba'i grogs pos bslus pa 'dis /
translated: This Licchavi, deceived by unwholesome friends,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang dag par ma lags pas skur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la yang dag par ma lags pas skur te /
translated: falsely accused the venerable Upāli.

original: dge 'dun gyis de la lhung bzed khas dbub pa mdzad pa las /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis de la lhung bzed khas dbub pa mdzad pa las /
translated: The saṅgha turned his alms-bowl face down.

original: li tstsha b'i chen po lhung bzed khas phub pa de /
analyzed: li tstsha b'i chen po lhung bzed khas phub pa de /
translated: The Licchavi, his alms-bowl turned face down,

original: dge 'dun las lhung bzed slar bzlog pa gsol na /
analyzed: dge 'dun las lhung bzed slar bzlog pa gsol na /
translated: is requesting the saṅgha to take back the alms-bowl.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis li tstsha b'i chen po la lhung bzed slar bzlog par mdzad do //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis li tstsha b'i chen po la lhung bzed slar bzlog par mdzad do //
translated: If the time is right and the saṅgha is ready, the saṅgha should allow it. The saṅgha will take back the alms-bowl of the Licchavi.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the request.

original: bcabs pa'i sems ma skyes na mtha' las ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcabs pa'i sems ma skyes na mtha' las ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the thought of concealment does not arise, one rises from the defeat.

original: gang la bcab pa'i sems gcig kyang ma skyes na de pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang la bcab pa'i sems gcig kyang ma skyes na de pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not give rise to even one thought of concealment, then one rises from the downfall that is a defeat.🔽By what means does one rise?

original: thabs gang gis ldang bar 'gyur zhen de'i phyir bslab pa spyod pas so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: thabs gang gis ldang bar 'gyur zhen de'i phyir bslab pa spyod pas so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: For that reason it is said, “By practicing the training.”

original: bslab pa spyod pa de gang gis bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa spyod pa de gang gis bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: By what is that practice of the training accomplished?

original: de'i phyir de thob pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de thob pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For that reason it is said, “By obtaining it.”

original: bslab pa la spyod pa thob pas bsgrub par bya'i ma thob pas ma yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa la spyod pa thob pas bsgrub par bya'i ma thob pas ma yin no //
translated: The practice of the training is accomplished by obtaining it, not by not obtaining it.

original: su las thob pa zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: su las thob pa zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: From whom is it obtained?

original: dge 'dun las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For that reason it is said, “From the saṅgha.”

original: dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa sbyin par lan gsum gsol te /
analyzed: dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa sbyin par lan gsum gsol te /
translated: From the saṅgha, the training is given for as long as one lives, by requesting it three times.

original: thob pas ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pas ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By obtaining it, one rises.

original: gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa ni /
translated: The mantra of the request is recited three times.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong dga' byed kyis bslab pa ma phul bar mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i tshes bsten kyang bcabs pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcabs par ma bgyis te bdag dge slong dga' byed dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa gsol na /
analyzed: bdag dge slong dga' byed kyis bslab pa ma phul bar mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i tshes bsten kyang bcabs pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcabs par ma bgyis te bdag dge slong dga' byed dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa gsol na /
translated: I, the monk Nandī, having not relinquished the precepts, engaged in the act of sexual intercourse, but not even for a single moment did I harbor a thought of concealment. I, the monk Nandī, request the precepts for as long as I live from the saṅgha.

original: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du /
translated: The venerable saṅgha, out of compassion,

original: bdag dge slong dga' byed la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa stsal du gsol //
analyzed: bdag dge slong dga' byed la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa stsal du gsol //
translated: please grant me, the monk Nandī, the precepts for as long as I live.

original: lan gsum du bzlas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is to be repeated three times.

original: dge 'dun gyis de la ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis de la ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the saṅgha grant it?

original: de'i phyir las kyis sbyin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽gsol ba dang bzhi'i @304a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyis sbyin no zhes bya ba smras te / gsol ba dang bzhi'i @304a * //
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is given by the rite.”

original: las kyis sbyin no //
analyzed: las kyis sbyin no //
translated: It is given by the rite of proposal and four requests.🔽Its mantra is:

original: de'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: de'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong dga' byed 'dis bslab pa ma phul bar mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten kyang bcabs pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcabs par ma bgyis te /
analyzed: dge slong dga' byed 'dis bslab pa ma phul bar mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten kyang bcabs pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcabs par ma bgyis te /
translated: This monk Nandī has not offered his training, but has practiced sexual intercourse, which is not celibate. He has not concealed even a single thought of concealment.

original: dge slong dga' byed 'di dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa gsol na /
analyzed: dge slong dga' byed 'di dge 'dun las ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa gsol na /
translated: If the Saṅgha grants monk Nandī the training for as long as he lives,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong dga' byed la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa stsol to //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong dga' byed la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa stsol to //
translated: if the time has come for the Saṅgha, and the Saṅgha is patient, then let the Saṅgha consent. The Saṅgha is granting monk Nandī the training for as long as he lives.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the motion.

original: dus ji srid du zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: de'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “for as long as he lives.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshogs dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshogs dag las /
translated: Here the text is from the Kṣudraka Collection:

original: dge slong dag dge slong dga' byed 'di la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa phyin cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong dga' byed 'di la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bslab pa phyin cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha said, Monks, give the novice monk Nanda training for life.

original: gang gi tshe dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa de'i tshe na ni bslab pa byin pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa de'i tshe na ni bslab pa byin pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: When one obtains arhatship, one is not said to be given training,

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all causes of error, such as attachment, are abandoned.

original: ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang / shes pas ni gcig gi mdun du bshags pas dge 'dun lhag ma dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang / shes pas ni gcig gi mdun du bshags pas dge 'dun lhag ma dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are ashamed, who uphold the sūtras, who uphold the vinaya, who uphold the mātṛkā, and who are wise, are purified by confession in the presence of one.

original: de dag gis ni gang zag gcig gi mdun du bshags pas chog gi / yongs su gnas pa dang mgu ba dag spyad par bya mi dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gang zag gcig gi mdun du bshags pas chog gi / yongs su gnas pa dang mgu ba dag spyad par bya mi dgos pa nyid do //
translated: They are purified by confessing in the presence of one person, and it is not necessary for them to perform the penance and the pleasing of the saṅgha.

original: bsam pas ltung ba las ldang gi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pas ltung ba las ldang gi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They rise from downfalls by intention, not by the action of punishment.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir chad pa'i las bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir chad pa'i las bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The purpose of the rite of demotion is to generate a special attitude.

original: gal te chad pa'i las med par bsam pa'i khyad par skye na chad pa'i las mi dgos so //
analyzed: gal te chad pa'i las med par bsam pa'i khyad par skye na chad pa'i las mi dgos so //
translated: If a special attitude arises without the rite of demotion, then the rite is not necessary.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: sil bu dag las de lta bas na gang dag rnam pa de lta bur rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sil bu dag las de lta bas na gang dag rnam pa de lta bur rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Therefore, those who naturally have a sense of shame and modesty should confess in the presence of one person.”🔽It is said that one should confess downfalls by name and type.

original: ltung ba ming dang rigs dang ldan par brjod par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'dir ming ni rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin /🔽rigs ni rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba ming dang rigs dang ldan par brjod par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'dir ming ni rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin / rigs ni rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the name and what is the type?

original: de'i phyir @304b 'dir ming ni ltung byed kyi sde tshan las ming ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir @304b 'dir ming ni ltung byed kyi sde tshan las ming ngo //
translated: Therefore, here the name is the name of the class of downfalls.

original: byung ba ni rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byung ba ni rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The occurrence is the type.

original: sde tshan la brten nas ltung ba rnams kyi ming du grags pa gang yin pa de ni ming yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sde tshan la brten nas ltung ba rnams kyi ming du grags pa gang yin pa de ni ming yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The name of the class of downfalls should be understood as the name of the downfalls based on the class.

original: byung ba gang yin pa de ni rigs yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba gang yin pa de ni rigs yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The occurrence of the downfall should be understood as the type of the class.

original: das na pham par 'gyur ba dang ; dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas zhes bya ba ltung byed kyi sde tshan lnga po dag ni mang ngo //
analyzed: das na pham par 'gyur ba dang ; dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas zhes bya ba ltung byed kyi sde tshan lnga po dag ni mang ngo //
translated: Thus, the five classes of downfalls—defeats, residual defilements, downfalls requiring confession alone, faults, and wrong actions—are numerous.

original: mi gsod ba la sogs pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'byung ba dang / bsams bzhin du khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma byung ba dang / sra brkyang phyung nas zhag bcu las 'das par gos rnam par ma brtags pa 'chang ba la sogs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed dang /
analyzed: mi gsod ba la sogs pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'byung ba dang / bsams bzhin du khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma byung ba dang / sra brkyang phyung nas zhag bcu las 'das par gos rnam par ma brtags pa 'chang ba la sogs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed dang /
translated: The occurrence of a defeat, such as killing a human, the occurrence of a residual defilement, such as intentionally emitting semen, the occurrence of a downfall requiring confession alone, such as keeping and using a storage container in excess of the permitted ten day period, the occurrence of a fault, such as sitting on the same seat as a woman, and the occurrence of a wrong action, such as playing in water, are the types of the classes.

original: shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i ltung byed byung ba dang / nye du ma yin pa'i dge slong ma'i lag nas bza' ba dang bca' ba len pa la sogs pa'i so sor bshags pa byung ba dang / sham thabs zlum por ma bgos pa la sogs pa'i nyes byas byung ba ni rigs yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i ltung byed byung ba dang / nye du ma yin pa'i dge slong ma'i lag nas bza' ba dang bca' ba len pa la sogs pa'i so sor bshags pa byung ba dang / sham thabs zlum por ma bgos pa la sogs pa'i nyes byas byung ba ni rigs yin no //
translated: It is proper to confess a downfall of lying in full awareness, a downfall of accepting food or drink directly from an unrelated nun, and so forth, and a downfall of wearing one’s lower robe in an unbecoming manner.🔽Here, the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa ltung ba rnams kyi ming zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa ltung ba rnams kyi ming zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: Venerable One, the downfalls are called by name

original: rigs zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: rigs zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: and are also called by type.

original: btsun pa ming ni gang lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ming ni gang lags /
translated: Venerable One, what is the name?

original: rigs ni gang lags /
analyzed: rigs ni gang lags /
translated: What is the type?

original: nye ba 'khor pham par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor pham par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: Venerable One, the term “parajika” is the name.

original: byung ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: byung ba ni rigs so //
translated: “Downfall” is the type.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: The term “sanghâvaśesa” is the name.

original: byung ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: byung ba ni rigs so //
translated: “Downfall” is the type.

original: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba dang nyes byas zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba dang nyes byas zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: The terms “pāyantika,” “pratideśanīya,” and “duṣkṛta” are the names.

original: byung ba ni rigs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byung ba ni rigs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Downfall” is the type.

analyzed: byas sam ma byas zhes bya bas ni ci bdag gis deng las shig byas sam 'on te ma byas snyam du las kyi 'jug pa'i skabs la dogs pa bstan to //
translated: “Done or not done?” shows doubt about the occasion of the action, thinking, “Did I do this action today or not?”

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid deng bdag las shig byas so zhes de ltar las byas pa nyid du yid la snang bas na bdag gis las de'i ngo bo nyid ci zhig byas /🔽ci bdag gis khu ba 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid dam lus kyis reg pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'am ci zhig byas @305b zhes ngo bo nyid kyi yul la dogs pa bstan to //

translated: “What?” refers to the self, thinking, “Today I did this action,” and thus the appearance of the action in the mind.🔽“What is the nature of that action I did?” shows doubt about the object, the nature of the action.

original: ji lta bu zhig ces bya bas ni bdag gis deng khu ba 'byin pa'am lus kyis rig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi las byas na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ces bya bas ni bdag gis deng khu ba 'byin pa'am lus kyis rig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi las byas na /
translated: “What kind of action?” shows doubt about the object, the nature of the action, thinking, “Today I did an action that was the nature of emitting semen or the nature of physical contact, and so on.

original: ci de bsams bzhin du byas sam 'on te /
analyzed: ci de bsams bzhin du byas sam 'on te /
